channel.title: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!
channel.description:
Okay, some of you have heard of this, some of you may have not, but I've currently the Vista Black Screen... of [FONT='Arial Black']DEATH[/FONT]! (Cue the overly-dramatic music).
Actually, it's not that bad. It just takes an ungodly amount of time to load explorer.exe, and in that time I'm usually taking a shower. Nonetheless, I want to get rid of it. I've read in many forums that if I can find the Vista Media disk that it is repairable... But... I can't find it, and I don't want to have to use my recovery disks and lose all my saved games, and files.
Anyone have some suggestions, or should I just suck it up? :meh:

item.title: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Windows 7 runs like XP but looks like Vista.

And in terms of boot time, frequently used programs load time, general system slowdown over time, it rapes both Vista and XP.

My dual boot XP/7 used to be faster to load XP, now XP loads twice slower and 7 still takes the same time as when it was fresh.

Read full topic
item.source: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!

item.title: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Vista needed service packs to finally be decent. Windows 7 was decent as early as the public betas.

But let’s be technical, Windows 7 is basically an upgraded Vista.

item.source: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!

item.title: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!
item.dc:creator: DethklokSoldier
item.description:
I got a free Windows 7 upgrade when I bought my new PC. In my opinion its better than Vista, simply because there aren’t as many annoying security prompts. They still pop up from time to time, but not as frequently. The only thing I miss from XP is the fact that Morrowind just doesn’t run the same on Vista and 7. That’s why I keep an extra hard drive with XP on it. Just to play Morrowind. Other than that, Windows 7 is much less of a head ache.

Read full topic
item.source: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!

item.title: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!
item.dc:creator: Lost_one
item.description:
duh4563:

am i the only one who has never had a problem with vista?

No. Honestly, I use Vista. To be quite honest, the difference between vista and Windows seven, atleast to me are the bells and whistles. They pretty much look the same otherwise. atleast to me. Vista has everything I need. There will be a day I need to upgrade but until I actually do (which will be the day they stop making games for Vista), I will. shrugs

Read full topic
item.source: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!

item.title: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
Vista was atleast pretty, XP makes me feel like gouging my eyes out, always has. Win 7 has a few extras when it comes to looks, but basically it is a software overhaul of Vista.

Oh, they did fucked up the Network/ Shared files and stuff. Something that totally pissed me off for both Win 7 and on a lesser degree Vista. Stupid new system involving homegroups and shit.

Read full topic

item.title: The Vista Black Screen of DEATH!
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

^ no, because

  1. Better encryption software, and pointless launguage configurations can be found better and for free.

Knowing Sersoft, he just wanted the Ultimate pack, because he is Ultimate (?)

Win 7 Professional = Win.

No because I live in Quebec and most people who I install windows for prefer their OS in French, that way I can use my main Windows DVD out of the box.

I would use 7 Pro if it fit on a 700MB CD but it doesn’t, anything below Ultimate and you’re wasting space on your DVD.

And going back to my original point, on TPB ultimate has the most seeds.
